meanings.definition: To split or tear apart forcefully
meanings.sent1: She used all her strength to rive the fabric in two.
meanings.sent2: The axe was able to rive the log into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's incredible power allowed him to effortlessly rive through solid steel.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to rive the very sky in half.
meanings.sent5: The loud explosion caused the ground to rive open before our eyes.

meanings.definition: To break or divide into pieces
meanings.sent1: He carefully tried to rive the cookie into equal halves.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake's force was enough to rive the road into cracks.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician managed to rive the hat into multiple pieces during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to rive the canvas with each stroke.
meanings.sent5: The old book started to rive at the spine from years of use.

meanings.definition: To separate or split by force
meanings.sent1: The strong current began to rive the raft from the group.
meanings.sent2: The loud argument threatened to rive the family apart.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn knot refused to rive despite all efforts.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake's tremors seemed to rive the ground beneath our feet.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was enough to rive the silence with a single word.
